{{Infobox lake | name = Lac de la Cavayère | image = | caption = | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = [[Languedoc-Roussillon]] | coords = {{Coord|43|11|07|N|2|25|10|E|region:FR_type:waterbody|display=inline,title}} | type = [[artificial lake]] | inflow = [[Montirat, Aude|Montirat]], [[Bazalac]], [[Mitgé]] | outflow = | catchment = | basin_countries = France | length = | width = | area = {{convert|18|ha|abbr=on}} | depth = | max-depth = | volume = {{convert|1.5|e6m3|abbr=on}} | residence_time = | shore = | elevation = | islands = | cities = }} '''Lac de la Cavayère''' is an [[artificial lake]] in the [[Languedoc-Roussillon]] ''[[région in France|région]]'' of [[France]], close to the mediaeval town of [[Carcassonne]].
The lake, also known as ''Carcassonne Plage'' (in English, ''Carcassonne Beach''), was created by the building of a 23 metre high [[dam]] in 1988 after severe [[forest fires]] affected the area in 1985. The surface area of the lake, which is fed by the creeks of Montirat, Bazalac and Mitgé, is 180,000 m² and it is 1.5 million cubic metres in volume.
It is a short distance from the town of Carcassonne and has been made into a popular recreation area. Ducks and wildfowl are common and the 400,000 m² surrounding area is notable for a diversity of habitats, flora and fauna{{Citation needed|date=December 2009}}.
The beaches slope gently and there are supervised bathing areas. Boats are available for rent and there are [[picnic]] areas and a [[crazy golf]] course as well as a nearby [[chateau]].
During 2005 the lake was closed to bathing due to strong [[algae|algal blooms]].
==External links== *[http://www.carcassonne.org/Carcassonne_EN.nsf/vueTitre/docVisiterDetendre1?opendocument&EN&Visiter&Informations%20pratiques&8&&Informations%20pratiques Carcasonne tourist information about Lac de la Cavayère]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Lac De La Cavayere}} [[Category:Lakes of Aude|Cavayere]] [[Category:Reservoirs in France|Cavayere]]
{{Aude-geo-stub}}

revision.text:
This is a '''list of incidents of cannibalism''', or anthropophagy, as the consumption of human flesh or internal organs by other human beings. Accounts of [[cannibalism]] date back as far as Biblical times, and some anthropologists suggest that cannibalism was common in human societies as early as the [[Paleolithic Era]]. Historically, numerous tribal societies have engaged in cannibalism, although very few are thought to continue the practice to this day.
Occasionally, starving people have resorted to cannibalism for survival necessity. Classical antiquity recorded numerous references to cannibalism during siege starvations. More recent well-documented examples include the ''[[Essex (whaleship)|Essex]]'' sinking in 1820, the [[Donner Party]] in 1846 and 1847, and the [[Uruguayan Air Force Flight 571]]. Some murderers, such as [[Albert Fish]], [[Boone Helm]], [[Andrei Chikatilo]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], are known to have devoured their victims after killing them. Other individuals, such as artist [[Rick Gibson]] and journalist [[William Seabrook]], have legally consumed human flesh out of curiosity, or to attract attention to themselves.
==Prehistoric== *The 100,000-year-old bones of six [[Neanderthal]]s found in the [[Moula-Guercy]] Cave, France, had been broken by other Neanderthals in such a way as to extract marrow and brains. Finds made in the [[El Sidrón]] cave in Spain, also show endo-cannibalism.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/europes-hypocritical-history-of-cannibalism-42642371/?no-ist|title=Europe's Hypocritical History of Cannibalism|work=Smithsonian Magazine|date=24 April 2013|accessdate=21 November 2014}}</ref> *[[Cheddar Man]], a human skeleton dating from around 7150 BC, may have been a victim of cannibalism.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Bello |first1=SM|last2= Parfitt |first2=SA|last3= Stringer|first3= CB |title=Earliest directly-dated human skull-cups |journal=PLoS ONE |volume=6 |issue=2 |pages=e17026 |year=2011 |pmid=21359211 |pmc=3040189 |doi=10.1371/journal.pone.0017026}}</ref>
==Middle Ages== *[[Crusades|Crusaders]] were rumored to have practiced cannibalism during the [[Siege of Ma'arra]].<ref>Edward Peters, The First Crusade: The Chronicle of Fulcher of Chartres and Other Source Materials (University of Pennsylvania Press, 1998), 84.</ref> *For a brief time in Europe, an unusual form of cannibalism occurred when thousands of [[Mummy#Egyptian mummies as a commodity|Egyptian mummies]] preserved in [[bitumen]] were ground up and sold as medicine.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.mummytombs.com/dummy/doctors.htm |title = Medieval Doctors and Their Patients |publisher = mummytombs.com |accessdate = December 3, 2007 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071129013720/http://www.mummytombs.com/dummy/doctors.htm |archivedate = November 29, 2007 |df = }}</ref> The practice developed into a widespread business that flourished until the late 16th century. (As late as the early 19th century, mummies were still believed to have styptic properties against bleeding and were sold as pharmaceuticals in powdered form.<ref name="Daly flesh">Quotes from [[John Sanderson (merchant)|John Sanderson]]'s ''Travels'' (1586) in ''[https://www.jstor.org/stable/1345912 That Obscure Object of Desire: Victorian Commodity Culture and Fictions of the Mummy]'', [[Nicholas Daly]], NOVEL: A Forum on Fiction, Vol. 28, No. 1 (Autumn, 1994), pp. 24–51. {{doi|10.2307/1345912}}</ref>). This "fad" ended when the mummies were revealed actually to be recently killed slaves. *The [[Great Famine of 1315–1317]] was marked with extreme levels of cannibalism. *Several works by [[Michel de Montaigne]] and [[Jean de Léry]], among others, indicated that the [[Tupinambá people|Tupinambá]] tribe practiced cannibalism.<ref>Michel de Montaigne,''[[Essais]]'', Book 1, Chap. 31</ref><ref>Carlo Ginzburg (2012)''Threads and Traces: True, False, Fictive'', (papers), University of California Press, {{ISBN|9780520274488}}, Chapter 3: ''Montaigne, Cannibals, and Grottoes''</ref> *The [[Akokisa]] and [[Atakapa people]] of modern-day [[Texas]] practiced cannibalism.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thecajuns.com/attakpas.htm|title=Europe's Hypocritical History of Cannibalism|work=Attakapas|accessdate=21 November 2014}}</ref><ref>Newcomb, William Wilmon, Jr. ''The Indians of Texas: From Prehistoric to Modern Times.'' Austin: University of Texas Press, 1972:327</ref> *[[Island Caribs]] practiced ritualistic cannibalism.<ref>Foote, Nicola (ed.), ''The Caribbean History Reader'' (London: Routledge, 2013), p.2</ref> *The [[Wari' people]] practiced [[endocannibalism]], specifically mortuary cannibalism.<ref>[http://pib.socioambiental.org/en/povo/wari/865 "Wari': Funerary Cannibalism."] ''Povos Indígenas no Brasil.'' Retrieved 22 February 2012.</ref> *Numerous incidents of cannibalism were recorded during the drought of 1200–1201 in the [[Nile]] River region.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/ancient/egyptians/apocalypse_egypt_01.shtml |title=The Fall of the Egyptian Old Kingdom|publisher=BBC|date=17 February 2011|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref> *Cannibalism was widely practiced among the [[Aztec]]s.<ref>Diaz del Castillo, Bernal [c.1568](1956, p.178),''The Discovery And Conquest Of Mexico'', Farrar, Strauss and Cudahy USA oclc 56-5758</ref> *In 1503, a group of [[Qizilbash]] militants ate the corpses of their enemies after taking over a fort in east [[Iran]].<ref>История Востока В 6 т. / Отв. ред. Л. Б. Алаев, К. З. Ашрафян, Н. И. Иванов. Т. III. Восток на рубеже Средневековья и Нового времени. XVI—XVIII вв. М.: Издат. фирма «Восточ. лит-ра» РАН, 2000. С. 101.</ref> *The [[Korowai people]] claimed to have continued practicing cannibalism into the present day, as part of an attempt to encourage tourism.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/cannibals-may-be-feeding-the-lies/2006/09/17/1158431585605.html|title=Cannibals may be feeding the lies|website=The Sydney Morning Herald|author=John Garnaut|date=18 September 2006|accessdate=2006-10-25}}</ref> *[[Álvar Núñez Cabeza de Vaca]] along with other Spanish conquistadors committed cannibalism in the aftermath of a shipwreck.<ref>W. W. Newcomb, Jr.,''The Indians of Texas: From Prehistoric to Modern Times'' Austin: University of Texas Press, 1999, p. 77</ref> *On July 21, 1514, the captured Hungarian rebel leader [[György Dózsa]] was condemned to sit on a smouldering, heated iron throne, and forced to wear a heated iron crown and scepter (mocking his ambition to be king). While he was suffering, a procession of nine fellow rebels who had been starved beforehand were led to this throne. Next, executioners removed some pliers from a fire and forced them into Dózsa's skin. After tearing his flesh, the remaining rebels were ordered to bite spots where the hot pliers had been inserted and to swallow the flesh. The three or four who refused were simply cut up, prompting the others to comply. In the end, Dózsa died from the ordeal, while the rebels who obeyed were released.<ref>{{cite book|last=Barabási|first=Albert-László|title=Bursts|edition = First|year=2010|publisher=[[Penguin Group]]|location=New York, United States|isbn=0-525-95160-1|pages=263–266}}</ref> *In 1563 French settlers from [[Charlesfort-Santa Elena Site]] are reported to have resorted to cannibalism while fleeing back to Europe. *[[Peter Stumpp]], nicknamed the "Werewolf of Bedburg", was executed in October of 1589 after accusations of cannibalism and other crimes.
==17th–19th centuries== ===1600s=== *In colonial [[Jamestown, Virginia|Jamestown, Virginia, United States]], colonists resorted to cannibalism during a period from 1609 to 1610 known as the [[Starving Time]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Wade|first=Nicholas|title=Evidence of Cannibalism Found at Jamestown Site|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/02/science/evidence-of-cannibalism-found-at-jamestown-site.html|accessdate=May 1, 2013|newspaper=The New York Times|date=May 1, 2013}}</ref> After food supplies had diminished, some colonists began to dig up corpses for food. During this period, one man was tortured until he confessed to having killed, salted, and eaten his pregnant wife; he was burned alive as punishment.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.history.org/Foundation/journal/Winter07/jamestown.cfm |title=The official site of Colonial Williamsburg — Things which seame incredible: Cannibalism in Early Jamestown |publisher=History.org |accessdate=August 30, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|author=Dennis Montgomery|title=1607: Jamestown and the New World|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YVxfJAzgii0C|year=2007|publisher=Colonial Williamsburg|isbn=978-0-87935-232-5|pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=YVxfJAzgii0C&pg=PA75 75–81], [https://books.google.com/books?id=YVxfJAzgii0C&pg=PA82 82–85], "There are, then, at least half a dozen written seventeenth century reports of Starving Time cannibalism, each of which corroborates another in one or more details." (p.[https://books.google.com/books?id=YVxfJAzgii0C&pg=PA85 85])}}</ref> *In 1612, Polish troops stationed in the [[Moscow Kremlin]] resorted to cannibalism, in the aftermath of a prolonged siege.<ref>К. Валишевский. «Смутное время». М., 1993. С. 293–294. {{ISBN|5-8498-0037-9}}</ref> *A party of Cossacks under [[Vassili Poyarkov]] cannibalized the corpses of Siberian aborigines they had previously killed.<ref>W Bruce Lincoln, ''The Conquest of a Continent'', p. 65, citing Akheograficheskaya Kommissia,''Dopolneniia k Aktam Istoricheskim'', St Petersburg 1846–72, III, document 12, pp. 52–60.</ref> *On August 20, 1672, a Christian mob lynched and ate parts of [[Johan de Witt]], a political leader and follower of Spinoza.<ref>{{aut|Kok, J.}} (1794) ''Vaderlandsch woordenboek; oorspronkelijk verzameld door Jacobus Kok. Deel 32'', p. 352; {{aut|Veeghens, D.}} (1884) ''Historische studien: Uitg. door J.D. Veegens. Eerste Deel'', p. 48; the first name of Verhoeff was Hendrick according to {{aut|Fruin, R.}} (1901) ''Robert Fruin's verspreide geschriften'', p. 374, note 2</ref>
===1700s=== *The accounts of the sinking of the ''[[Luxborough Galley]]'' in 1727 reported cannibalism amongst the survivors during their two weeks on a small boat in the mid-Atlantic. *French showman and soldier [[Tarrare]] had reportedly engaged in cannibalism. *Polish soldier [[Charles Domery]] ate pieces of a fellow crew member's severed leg. *The July issue of 'The Gentleman's Magazine' contains a sworn account given February 1736, by two sailors, Thomas Thompson (born in Rhode-Island) and Simon McCrone (born in Drogheda), crew survivors from a slave carrying ship, 'MARY' lost at sea en route from Lisbon to Guinea. The account given by the two seamen covers a period from mid-1735 when they first set sail until January 1736 when they were rescued by Glanveil Nicholas, master of a scooner, who picked them up close to and landed them in Bridgetown, Barbadoes where they gave their sworn disposition. The men described in some detail (approx.800 words) how the ship sprung a leak, the slaves were unchained to help pump, how the ship finally sank, how eight men abandoned ship and some later ate human flesh as a means of surviving before Thompson and McCrone were rescued.<ref>The Gentleman's Magazine, July 1737</ref> *In 1763, [[North American Indians]] performed an act of ritual cannibalism on a British soldier during the [[Siege of Fort Detroit]].
===1800s=== [[File:Raft of the Medusa - Theodore Gericault.JPG|thumb|alt=Painting of a raft surrounded by huge ocean waves with people crying for help, suffering and dying.|''[[Raft of the Medusa]]'' by [[Théodore Géricault]], 1819]] *In an 1809 incident known as the [[Boyd massacre|''Boyd'' massacre]], about 66 passengers and crew of the ''Boyd'' were killed and eaten by [[Māori people|Māori]] on the Whangaroa peninsula, [[Northland Region|Northland]], in northern New Zealand. *In 1816, the French frigate [[French frigate Méduse (1810)|''Méduse'']] ran aground off Mauritania, and 147 passengers and crew took to sea on a hastily constructed raft. In the chaotic 13 days before they were rescued, the occupants of the raft were driven to suicide, murder, and cannibalism; only 15 men survived the experience. *The ''[[Essex (whaleship)|Essex]]'' was sunk by a [[sperm whale]] in the Pacific Ocean, in 1820. Most survivors of Captain Pollard's ship spent 90 days in small whaling boats before being rescued. Seven of the members who died during the 90 days were documented to have been eaten, some after they died, two others who were sacrificed for that purpose after drawing lots. One of the small boats was found containing two survivors sucking on the marrow of a human bone. The tale of the ''Essex'' inspired [[Herman Melville]] to write his novel, ''[[Moby-Dick]]'' (1851). *In 1822, [[Alexander Pearce]], an Irish convict, led an escape from [[Macquarie Harbour Penal Settlement]] in [[Van Diemen's Land]]. Pearce was captured near [[Hobart, Tasmania|Hobart]] and confessed that he and the other escapees had successively killed and cannibalised members of their group over a period of weeks, he being the last survivor.<ref>{{cite news |last= Collins |first=Paul |url= http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2002/10/28/1035683357802.html |title= A journey through hell's gate |work= The Age |date= October 29, 2002 |accessdate= August 1, 2012}}</ref> *The May 27, 1826 issue of ''The [[Acadian Recorder]]'' reported that the surviving crew of the ship ''[[Francis Mary]]'' resorted to cannibalism.<ref>{{cite news |work= The Acadian Recorder|date=May 27, 1826 |title= Article about the ''Francis Mary'' }}</ref> *According to the [[Coffin Handbills]], [[Andrew Jackson]] murdered 1,000 Native Americans. He slept in the field of their corpses before he cannibalized 12 bodies on the following morning.<ref>{{cite book |first=John |last=Taliaferro |title=Supplemental account of some of the bloody deeds of General Jackson, being a supplement to the "Coffin handbill." [Cuts of 6 coffins] |publisher=Members of Congress. |location=Northern Neck, Virginia |year=1828 |url=https://www.loc.gov/resource/rbpe.18601400/ }}</ref> *[[John Williams (missionary)|John Williams]] of the [[London Missionary Society]] and a colleague were killed and eaten at Dillon Bay, [[Erromango]] island, [[Vanuatu]], in 1839.<ref>{{coord|18|49|00|S|169|00|30|E|display=inline|region:GB_scale:30000}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/8398126.stm |title= Island holds reconciliation over cannibalism |work=''BBC News''|accessdate=2009-12-07 |date= December 7, 2009}}</ref> *[[Liver-Eating Johnson]] reportedly ate the livers of [[Crow Nation|Crow]] warriors he had previously slain. *In the United States, the group of settlers known as the [[Donner Party]] resorted to cannibalism while snowbound in the Sierra Nevada mountains, for the winter of 1846–1847. *The last survivors of Captain [[Sir John Franklin]]'s [[Franklin's lost expedition|lost arctic expedition]] of 1845 were found to have resorted to cannibalism in their final push across [[King William Island]], Canada, towards the [[Back River (Nunavut)|Back River]].<ref>{{cite book|author=Beattie, Owen & Geiger, John |date=2004|title=Frozen in Time|isbn= 1-55365-060-3}}</ref> *[[Boone Helm]], also known as "The Kentucky Cannibal", was an American [[mountain man]], [[serial killer]], and fugitive, who ate human flesh on several occasions between 1850 and 1854, often out of necessity in extreme conditions. He made no secret of the fact and is reported to have said: "Many's the poor devil I've killed, at one time or another ... and the time has been that I've been obliged to feed on some of 'em". *In the United States, 10 survivors found nearly two months after the [[Utter Party Massacre]] of 1860 had eaten five deceased party members.<ref>{{cite journal |last=Schlicke |first=Carl P. |title=Massacre on the Oregon Trail: A Tale of Horror, Cannibalism & Three Remarkable Children |work=Columbia Magazine |volume=1 |issue=1 |date=Spring 1987 |pages=33–43 |url=http://www.washingtonhistory.org/files/library/01-1_Schlicke.pdf}}</ref> *In November 1874, three British sailors survived by committing cannibalism acts in the aftermath of the'' [[Cospatrick (ship)|Cospatrick]] ''disaster.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/wales/north_west/3129629.stm|title=Guided tours reveal island secrets|date=6 August 2003|accessdate=24 November 2014|work=''BBC News''}}</ref> *[[Alferd Packer]] was an American [[Prospecting|prospector]] who was accused of cannibalism during the winter of 1873-1874. First tried for murder, Packer was eventually sentenced to 40 years in prison after being convicted of [[manslaughter]].<ref>{{cite news|author=Nash, Robert Jay |year=1994|title=Alferd Packer|url=https://books.google.com/books/about/Encyclopedia_of_western_lawmen_outlaws.html?id=k1AsAngDzBEC|work= Encyclopedia of Western Lawmen & Outlaws|publisher=Da Capo Press|pages= 250–251|isbn= 0-306-80591-X|accessdate= 2012-01-07}}</ref> *The case of ''[[R v. Dudley and Stephens]]'' (1884) 14 QBD 273 (QB) is an English case which dealt with four crew members of an English yacht, the ''Mignonette'', who were cast away in a storm some {{convert|1600|mi|km}} from the [[Cape of Good Hope]]. After several days, one of the crew, a 17-year-old cabin boy, fell unconscious due to a combination of starvation and drinking seawater. The others (one possibly objecting) decided then to kill him and eat him. They were picked up four days later. Two of the three survivors were found guilty of murder. A significant outcome of this case was that [[necessity (criminal law)|necessity]] was determined to be no defence against a charge of murder. *A report dated to July 28, 1892 indicates that three people were convicted on charges of cannibalism in the [[Sahalin]] [[penal colony]]. Two songs referencing cannibalism were also recorded among the residents of the colony.<ref>Новодворский В., Дорошевич В. Коронка в пиках до валета. Каторга.. — СПб.: Санта, 1994. — 20 000 экз. — {{ISBN|5-87243-010-8}}</ref>
==20th century== ===1900s=== *The Protestant missionaries [[James Chalmers (missionary)|James Chalmers]] and [[Oliver Fellows Tomkins]] were murdered and cannibalized on [[Goaribari Island]], [[Papua New Guinea]] on April 8, 1901.<ref name="Lennox1902">{{cite book|last=Lennox|first=Cuthbert|title=James Chalmers of New Guinea: Missionary, Pioneer, Martyr|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EikOAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA190|edition=Public domain|year=1902|publisher=Andrew Melrose|pages=190–01}}</ref> *During the course of the [[Bailundo Revolt]], a group of [[Ovimbundu]] rebels decapitated a native merchant named Antonio de Silveira, roasted, and then consumed his body. The rebels forced Silveira's wife to carry his head in a basket. The killing held a ritualistic purpose aiming to produce "success magic", as the perpetrators belonged to the [[Kandundu Cult]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://run.edu.ng/media/1834181203243.pdf|title=The Bailundo Revolt of 1902|website=Redeemer's University|author=Douglas Wheeler|accessdate=9 May 2015}}</ref>
===1910s=== *The crew members of the steamship, ''[[SS Dumaru|Dumaru]]'', spent three weeks adrift in a lifeboat, after the ship exploded and sank in the western Pacific Ocean on October 16, 1918. Quickly exhausting their supply of food and water, they resorted to cannibalism to survive.<ref>{{cite book | last = Thomas | first = Lowell | title = The Wreck of the Dumaru | publisher = [[Doubleday (publisher)|Doubleday]], Doran & Company, Inc. | year = 1930 | location = [[Garden City, New York]] }}</ref>
===1920s=== *During the [[Russian famine of 1921–1922]], there were many reports of cannibalism. *Serial killer [[Albert Fish]] caused much debate over whether or not he was insane, because he consumed his victims. He confessed to molesting more than 400 children over 20 years and is believed to have murdered somewhere between 6 and 15 children.<ref>{{cite news|authors=Litton, S. & Hickey, E.W. (Ed.)|year=2006|title=Characteristics of Child Molesters|work=Sex Crimes and Paraphilia|location=New Jersey|publisher= Pearson}}</ref> Psychiatrist [[Fredric Wertham]] described Fish as looking like "a meek and innocuous little old man, gentle and benevolent, friendly and polite. If you wanted someone to entrust your child to, he would be the one you would choose".<ref>{{cite news |authors= Cyriax, Oliver & Wilson, Colin & Wilson, Damon |year=2006 |work= [[The Encyclopedia of Crime]] |title= Albert Fish |location= Woodstock |publisher= The Overlook Press |page= 144}}</ref> Fish's most infamous murder is that of Grace Budd in 1928, whose flesh he cut into strips, and cooked with carrots, onions, and strips of bacon. This excited him sexually.<ref>{{cite news |title= Albert Fish |author= Wilson, Colin & Seaman, Donald |work= The Serial Killers |publisher= Virgin Publishing Ltd |year= 2004 |page= 69}}</ref> Dr. Wertham described how Fish's account of the culinary process was "like a housewife describing her favorite methods of cooking. You had to remind yourself that this was a little girl he was talking about".<ref>{{cite journal | last1= Howitt |first1= D |year= 2006 |title= What Is the Role of Fantasy in Sex Offending? |journal= [[Criminal Behavior and Mental Health]] |volume=14 |issue=3 |pages= 182–188 }}</ref> When the same psychiatrist declared Fish mad, Fish disagreed and stated he was just "queer".<ref name=Vronsky2004/> *On December 20, 1924, German authorities uncovered pieces of human flesh along with a list of 40 people [[Karl Denke]] had previously killed and cannibalized.
===1930s=== *Author James Crissmman claims that reports from the 1930s indicate that residents of the [[Appalachian Mountains]] practised a form of ritualistic cannibalism, during which cannibals ate parts of their dead relatives in order to honour them.<ref>{{cite book |author= Crissman, James K. |title=Death and Dying in Central Appalachia: Changing Attitudes and Practices |publisher= University of Illinois Press |date= 1994 |pages= 113–6}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title= The Register |author= Morton, Jennie C. (ed.) |publisher= Kentucky Historical Society|date=1947|page=42}}</ref> *Prior to 1931, ''[[The New York Times]]'' reporter [[William Buehler Seabrook]], allegedly in the interests of research, obtained from a hospital intern at the [[Sorbonne (building)|Sorbonne]] a chunk of human meat from the body of a healthy human killed in an accident, then cooked and ate it. He reported, : "It was like good, {{sic|hide=y|fully|-}}developed [[veal]], not young, but not yet beef. It was very definitely like that, and it was not like any other meat I had ever tasted. It was so nearly like good, fully developed veal that I think no person with a palate of ordinary, normal sensitiveness could distinguish it from veal. It was mild, good meat with no other sharply defined or highly characteristic taste such as for instance, goat, high game, and pork have. The steak was slightly tougher than prime veal, a little stringy, but not too tough or stringy to be agreeably edible. The roast, from which I cut and ate a central slice, was tender, and in color, texture, smell as well as taste, strengthened my certainty that of all the meats we habitually know, veal is the one meat to which this meat is accurately comparable".<ref>{{cite book |author= Seabrook, William Bueller |title= Jungle Ways |location= London, Bombay, Sydney |publisher= George G. Harrap and Company |date= 1931}}</ref><ref> {{cite book|author=Allen, Gary |date=1999 |url=http://food.oregonstate.edu/ref/culture/taboo_allen.html |title=What is the Flavor of Human Flesh? |publisher=Presented at the Symposium Cultural and Historical Aspects of Foods Oregon State University |location=Corvallis, Oregon |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080202122009/http://food.oregonstate.edu/ref/culture/taboo_allen.html |archivedate=2008-02-02 |df= }}</ref> *Cannibalism was widespread during the [[Holodomor]] (famine of Ukraine) in 1932 and 1933,<ref>{{cite news|last=Сокур |first=Василий [Sokur, Vasily] |date=November 21, 2008 |script-title=ru:Выявленным во время голодомора людоедам ходившие по селам медицинские работники давали отравленные "приманки" — кусок мяса или хлеба |url=http://fakty.ua/32809-vyyavlennym-vo-vremya-golodomora-lyudoedam-hodivshie-po-selam-medicinskie-rabotniki-davali-otravlennye-primanki---kusok-myasa-ili-hleba |work=[[Fakty i Kommentarii|Facts and Commentaries]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6DSsSzJHy?url=http://fakty.ua/32809-vyyavlennym-vo-vremya-golodomora-lyudoedam-hodivshie-po-selam-medicinskie-rabotniki-davali-otravlennye-primanki---kusok-myasa-ili-hleba |archivedate=January 6, 2013 |deadurl=no |language=ru |df= }}</ref> forcing Soviet officials to commission posters saying: "To eat your own children is a barbarian act".<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Várdy |first1= Steven Béla |last2=Várdy |first2= Agnes Huszár |year=2007 |title= Cannibalism in Stalin's Russia and Mao's China |url= http://www.paulbogdanor.com/left/cannibalism.pdf |journal= East European Quarterly |volume=41 |issue=2 |page= 225}}</ref> *An Italian woman named [[Leonarda Cianciulli]] killed three women in 1939 and 1940, turning their bodies into teacakes which she fed to others as well as consumed herself.
===1940s=== *Members of the [[Leopard Society]] centered in [[Sierra Leone]], [[Liberia]] and [[Côte d'Ivoire]], indulged in cannibalism.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.liberiapastandpresent.org/RitualKillings1900_1950b.htm |title= The Leopard Society Past and Present |id= "Africa in the mid-1900s" |accessdate=3 April 2008}}</ref> *There are eyewitness accounts of cannibalism during the [[Siege of Leningrad]] (1941–1944), including reports of people cutting off and eating their own flesh.<ref>{{Cite news |url= http://observer.guardian.co.uk/life/story/0,6903,605454,00.html |title= Orchestral manoeuvres (part one)|date=November 25, 2001|accessdate=July 27, 2007 |work=The Guardian | location=London | first=Ed | last=Vulliamy}}</ref> *Following the German surrender at the [[Battle of Stalingrad]] in January and February 1943, roughly 100,000 German soldiers were taken [[prisoner of war]] (POW). Almost all of them were sent to POW camps in [[Siberia]] or Central Asia where, due to being chronically underfed by their Soviet captors, many resorted to cannibalism. Fewer than 5,000 of the prisoners taken at Stalingrad survived captivity. The majority, however, died early in their imprisonment due to exposure or sickness brought on by conditions in the surrounded army before the surrender.<ref>{{cite book|author=Beevor, Antony|title=Stalingrad: The Fateful Siege|publisher=Penguin Books|date= 1999}}</ref> *The Australian War Crimes Section of the [[Tokyo Tribunal]], led by prosecutor [[William Webb (judge)|William Webb]] (the future Judge-in-Chief), collected numerous written reports and testimonies that documented Japanese soldiers' acts of cannibalism among their own troops, on enemy dead, and on Allied prisoners of war in many parts of the [[Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere]]. In September 1942, Japanese daily rations on New Guinea consisted of 800 grams of rice and tinned meat. However, by December, this had fallen to 50 grams.<ref name="happell">{{Cite book|last=Happell|first=Charles|title=The Bone Man of Kokoda|year=2008| publisher=Macmillan| location=Sydney| isbn=978-1-4050-3836-2}}</ref>{{rp|78–80}} According to historian Yuki Tanaka, "cannibalism was often a systematic activity conducted by whole squads and under the command of officers".<ref>{{cite book|author=Tanaka, Yuki|title=Hidden Horrors: Japanese War Crimes in World War II|publisher=Westview Press|date= 1996|page=127}}</ref>
:In some cases, flesh was cut from living people. An Indian POW, [[Lance Naik]] Hatam Ali (later a citizen of Pakistan), testified that in New Guinea: "the Japanese started selecting prisoners and every day one prisoner was taken out and killed and eaten by the soldiers. I personally saw this happen and about 100 prisoners were eaten at this place by the Japanese. The remainder of us were taken to another spot {{convert|50|mi|km|abbr=off}} away where 10 prisoners died of sickness. At this place, the Japanese again started selecting prisoners to eat. Those selected were taken to a hut where their flesh was cut from their bodies while they were alive and they were thrown into a ditch where they later died."<ref>{{cite book|author=Russell, Edward ([[Lord Russell of Liverpool]])|title=The Knights of Bushido, a Short History of Japanese War Crimes|publisher=Greenhill Books|date=2002|page=121}}</ref> *Another well-documented case occurred in [[Chichijima incident|Chichijima]] in February 1945, when Japanese soldiers killed and consumed five American airmen. This case was investigated in 1947 in a war crimes trial, and of 30 Japanese soldiers prosecuted, five (Maj. Matoba, [[Yoshio Tachibana|Gen. Tachibana]], Adm. Mori, Capt. Yoshii, and Dr. Teraki) were found guilty and hanged.<ref>{{Cite journal| format = PDF | url = http://www.pegc.us/archive/Articles/welch_naval_MCs.pdf | title = Without a Hangman, Without a Rope: Navy War Crimes Trials After World War II | chapter = Cannibalism | last = Welch | first = JM | journal = International Journal of Naval History | volume = 1 | issue = 1 |date=April 2002 | accessdate =December 3, 2007 | ref = harv}}</ref>
===1950s–1960s=== *A tradition of ritualistic cannibalism among the [[Fore people]] caused a [[Kuru (disease)|Kuru]] [[epidemic]], involving approximately 1000 deaths from 1957 to 1960.<ref>{{cite journal|journal = Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society B|year = 2008|volume = 363|pages = 3707–3713|title = The epidemiology of kuru: monitoring the epidemic from its peak to its end|author = Michael P. Alpers|doi = 10.1098/rstb.2008.0071|pmid = 18849286|issue = 1510|pmc = 2577135}}</ref> *German serial killer [[Joachim Kroll]], nicknamed "Duisburg Man-Eater", practised cannibalism.<ref>{{cite book |last=Dunning |first=John |title= Strange Deaths |publisher= Mulberry Editions |year=1992 |isbn=1-873123-13-2 |pages=218–219}}</ref> *In October 1961, [[Asmat people|Papuan aborigines]] supposedly killed and ate [[Michael Rockefeller]] while he was exploring southern Netherlands New Guinea.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2014/03/15/how-a-young-rockefeller-died-at-the-hands-of-cannibals/|title=How a young Rockefeller died at the hands of cannibals|work=New York Post|date=15 March 2014|accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> *In summer of 1963, Josef Kulík from [[Czechoslovakia]] (at that time serving compulsory [[military service]]) killed two young boys in a railway wagon. He cut their bodies open, roasted some of their internal organs on a fire, and ate them. He used some old funeral wreaths he had found near the wagon for fuel.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} *Factional violence and cannibalism occurred in the [[Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region]] of southeast China in 1968, during the [[Cultural Revolution]] (1966-1976).<ref>{{cite book|author=Zheng Yi|title=[[Scarlet Memorial: Tales Of Cannibalism In Modern China]]|publisher=Westview|date=1993}} passm.</ref>
===1970s=== *On July 13, 1970, police arrested Stanley Baker on charges of killing and cannibalizing a [[Montana]], U.S. resident.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} *In 1972, the survivors of [[Uruguayan Air Force Flight 571]], comprising the rugby team from [[Stella Maris College (Montevideo)|Stella Maris College]] in Montevideo and some of their family members, resorted to cannibalism while trapped at the crash site. They had been stranded since October 13, 1972, and rescue operations at the crash site did not begin until December 22, 1972. The story of the survivors was chronicled in [[Piers Paul Read]]'s 1974 memoir, ''[[Alive: The Story of the Andes Survivors]]'' (1974), in a film adaptation of the book, titled simply [[Alive (1993 film)|''Alive'']] (1993), and in the documentary: ''[[Stranded: I Have Come from a Plane That Crashed in the Mountains]]'' (2008). *Also in 1972, at the same time as the Andean incident, [[Marten Hartwell]] crashed his aircraft near the arctic circle in Canada's North West Territory. The three passengers died in the month it took searchers to find them, but Hartwell survived by eating part of one body. *In 1977, Briton [[Robert Maudsley]] killed a fellow inmate and consumed pieces of his brain. *In 1977 and 1978, the "Vampire of Sacramento" [[Richard Chase]] ate parts of his victims and drank their blood to treat his imaginary illnesses. *On August 20, 1979, Albert Fentress lured, killed and cannibalized an 18-year-old high school student.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}}{{Citation|last=|first=|title=New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1999/04/22/nyregion/jury-decides-hospitalized-killer-in-cannibalism-case-can-go-free.html|volume=|pages=}} *From 1979 to 1980, [[Nikolai Dzhumagaliev]] killed at least seven women and cannibalized their corpses.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/blog/2012/05/17/modern-cannibalism-six-killers-with-a-taste-for-human-flesh/index.html |title=Modern cannibalism: Six killers with a taste for human flesh |website=''Trutv.com'' |date=2012-05-17 |accessdate=2014-01-18}}</ref>
===1980s=== *On June 11, 1981, [[Issei Sagawa]] murdered a Dutch woman, named Renée Hartevelt, by shooting her in the neck with a rifle at his home in Paris, France. After having sex with the corpse, he began to eat her, starting with the buttocks and thighs. A few days later, he was discovered while attempting to dump the mutilated body into a lake and was subsequently arrested. He was held for two years without trial, then declared legally insane. Soon afterward, Japanese author [[Inuhiko Yomota]] published Sagawa's memoirs, including a detailed account of the murder. The book was a bestseller, and Sagawa became a minor celebrity. However, he was quickly extradited to Japan, where mental health professionals announced that he was perfectly sane. Because the French government refused to grant access to secret court documents, the Japanese authorities were unable to bring charges against him. He was released in 1986, and moved{{When|date=August 2016}} to Tokyo, Japan, where he is making a living as a freelance writer.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Morris|first=Steven|date=September 20, 2007|title=Issei Sagawa: Celebrity Cannibal|journal=New Criminologist, the On-line Journal of Criminology|publisher=New Criminologist|url=http://www.newcriminologist.com/article.asp?nid=17 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110714172725/http://www.newcriminologist.com/article.asp?nid=17|archivedate=July 14, 2011 }}</ref> *[[Ladislav Hojer]], a serial killer from [[Czechoslovakia]], confessed to killing a young woman in 1981. He cut off her breasts and vagina and tried to eat the latter with mustard, after boiling it in salty water. He later admitted he had thrown part of it away because of its underwhelming taste.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://kriminalistika.eu/muzeumzla/hojer/hojer.html|title=Ladislav Hojer|website=kriminalistika.eu|access-date=2016-06-24}}</ref> *[[Michael Woodmansee]] was convicted in 1983 of kidnapping and killing 5-year-old Jason Foreman in 1975 in South Kingstown, [[Rhode Island]]. There was evidence at the time that Woodmansee wrote in his journal of eating Foreman's flesh.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2011/03/08/father-says-murder-5-year-olds-killer/?intcmp=obinsite | publisher=Fox News Channel | title=Father of Murdered 5-Year-Old Says He'll Make Sure Killer Suffers Same Fate | date=March 8, 2011}}</ref> *In 1986, American [[Hadden Clark]] killed and cannibalized 6-year-old Michelle Dorr. *In November 1986, American [[Gary M. Heidnik]] abducted six women. After one of the women died, he fed the other victims a combination of dog food and human flesh. *In 1988, artist [[Rick Gibson]] legally performed an act of cannibalism by eating a [[canapé]] of donated human [[tonsils]] in Walthamstow High Street, London, England, United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite news | last = Young | first = Andrew | title = Rick eats his mate's tonsils on a cracker! | newspaper= The Sun | page= 3 | location= London, United Kingdom | date= 4 August 1988 }}</ref> A year later, he publicly ate a slice of legally purchased human testicle in Lewisham High Street, London.<ref>{{cite news | title = Never Mind the Bollocks… | magazine= Time Out | page= 11 | location= London, United Kingdom | date= 12 April 1989 }}</ref> When he tried to eat another slice of human testicle in Vancouver, Canada, in 1989, he was stopped by the police.<ref>{{cite news | last = Stueck | first = Wendy | title = Would-be cannibal's appetizer confiscated | newspaper= The Vancouver Sun | pages= A7 | location= Vancouver, Canada | date= 15 July 1989 }}</ref> However, the charge was dropped and he finally ate a testicle [[hors d'œuvre]] in Vancouver, in 1989.<ref>{{cite news | title = No charges laid over artist's testicle claim | newspaper= The Vancouver Sun | pages= B1 | location= Vancouver, Canada | date= 22 August 1988 }}</ref>
===1990s=== *[[Jeffrey Dahmer]], a serial killer living in [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], United States, murdered at least 17 young men and boys between 1978 and 1991. Following his arrest, he told police that he had cut up the thighs, biceps, and internal organs of several of his victims and cooked them in a stovetop skillet before consuming them. He claimed they tasted like ''[[filet mignon]]''.<ref>{{cite book|author=Ewing, C. P. & McCann, J. T. |date=2006|url=https://books.google.com/?id=nzp2-Ins-p4C&pg=PA149&dq=paraphilias+Jeffrey+Dahmer#v=onepage&q=cannibalism%20Jeffrey%20Dahmer&f=false |title=Minds on Trial: Great Cases in Law and Psychology|publisher= Oxford University Press|page=145|isbn= 0199884617}}</ref> *Over Thanksgiving weekend of 1991, newlywed [[Omaima Nelson|Omaima Aree Nelson]] murdered, dismembered, and cannibalized her husband, William E. "Bill" Nelson, in their [[Costa Mesa, California]] home. Pathology reports indicate Bill was still alive when Omaima began butchering his body, in which court and media reports indicate was a ritualistic manner. She then boiled and cooked his head in the oven, ate its flesh, and stored the foil-wrapped skull in the freezer; skinned his torso; deep fried his hands in oil; and cooked and dipped his ribs in barbecue sauce and tasted them.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://investigation.discovery.com/tv/happily-never-after/episodes/|work=Happily Never After|publisher=Investigation Discovery|title=Devoured By Love|date=18 August 2012|accessdate=19 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|journal=Los Angeles Times|title=Woman Denies Dismemberment Killing of Husband|date=12 December 1991| url=http://articles.latimes.com/1991-12-12/news/mn-336_1_william-nelson|accessdate=19 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Woman who cut up husband seeks parole today |date= 28 September 2001|journal=Orange County Register|author=Welborn, Larry|url=http://www.ocregister.com/articles/nelson-319333-omaima-pawloski.html|accessdate=19 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|accessdate=19 August 2012|journal=Daily News|location=New York|title=Omaima Aree Nelson, former model who murdered, then ate her husband wants to get out of prison early|author=Mandell, Nina|date=30 September 2011|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2011-09-30/news/30247964_1_parole-board-district-attorney-randy-pawloski-body-parts }}</ref> *[[Andrei Chikatilo]], a serial killer born in Ukraine, experienced killing and cannibalism as [[paraphilia]]. He was convicted for murder in 1992 and subsequently executed.<ref name=Vronsky2004>{{cite book|author=Vronsky, P. |date=2004|title=Serial Killers – The Method and Madness of Monsters|location= New York|publisher=The Berkley Publishing Group}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | last1 = White | first1 = J | year = 2007 | title = Evidence of Primary, Secondary, and Collateral Paraphilias Left at Serial Murder and Sex Offender Crime Scenes | journal = [[Journal of Forensic Sciences]] | volume = 52 | issue = 5| pages = 1194–1201 | pmid = 17681002 | doi=10.1111/j.1556-4029.2007.00523.x}}</ref> *During the [[North Korean famine]] that occurred between 1994 and 1998, there were leaked stories of cannibalism from North Korean refugees.<ref name="washingtonpost">{{Cite news| url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/ac2/wp-dyn/A41966-2003Oct3?language=printer | title =Opening a Window on North Korea's Horrors: Defectors Haunted by Guilt Over the Loved Ones Left Behind | date = October 4, 2003 | accessdate =July 27, 2007 | work=The Washington Post}}</ref>''' *The [[Chijon family]] was a South Korean gang that engaged in cannibalism.<ref>{{ko icon}} [http://www.imaeil.com/sub_news/sub_news_view.php?news_id=42900&yy=2008 지존파 살인사건] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129144202/http://www.imaeil.com/sub_news/sub_news_view.php?news_id=42900&yy=2008 |date=2014-11-29 }}</ref> *Ilshat Kuzikov, of [[St. Petersburg]], Russia, was convicted in March 1997 of eating three male acquaintances since 1992.<ref name=MN>{{cite news|author=Michael Newton|title=Ilshat Kuzikov|work=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA35|date=1 January 2006|publisher=Infobase Publishing|isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3|page=35}}</ref> *A court submission at the trial of perpetrators of the [[Snowtown murders]], in South Australia, revealed that two of the murderers fried and ate a part of their final victim in 1999.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/newsitems/200509/s1463414.htm |date=September 19, 2005 |title=Snowtown killers "cooked victim's flesh" |publisher=ABC News |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629023222/http://www.abc.net.au/news/newsitems/200509/s1463414.htm |archivedate=29 June 2011}}</ref> *[[Dorángel Vargas]], also known as "''el comegente''" (Spanish for "people-eater"), was a Venezuelan serial killer and cannibal who killed and ate at least 10 men in a period of two years preceding his arrest in 1999. *On August 13, 1999, [[Kazahstan]]i authorities arrested three male psychiatric nurses on charges of killing and eating seven prostitutes.<ref>{{cite news|work=''BBC News''|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/419522.stm|title=Three arrested for cannibalism in Kazakhstan |date=13 August 1999|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref>
==21st century== ===2000s=== *In February 2000, [[Katherine Knight]] killed her partner John Price and cooked his corpse, later preparing to serve it to his children.<ref>{{cite web|title=Katherine Knight q&a|url=http://www.aww.com.au/living/arts-entertainment/2002/10/katherine-knight-qa/|work=[[The Australian Women's Weekly]]|publisher=Ninemsn Pty Ltd|accessdate=24 December 2013|date=22 October 2002|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131224122543/http://www.aww.com.au/living/arts-entertainment/2002/10/katherine-knight-qa/|archivedate=24 December 2013|df=}}</ref> *In 2000, the Chinese performance artist [[Zhu Yu (artist)|Zhu Yu]] claimed to have prepared, cooked, and eaten human fetuses<ref>{{Cite web|title = Baby-eating photos are part of Chinese artist's performance |url = http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/local/archives/2001/03/23/78704|work=Taipei Times|date=23 March 2001}}</ref> as an artistic performance.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Rojas | first1 = Carlos | year = 2002 | title = Cannibalism and the Chinese Body Politic: Hermeneutics and Violence in Cross-Cultural Perception | url = http://www3.iath.virginia.edu/pmc/text-only/issue.502/12.3rojas.txt | journal = Post Modern Culture | volume = 12 | issue = 3 | doi=10.1353/pmc.2002.0025}}</ref> He was prosecuted for his actions by the Chinese government.<ref>{{Cite web|title = 录像作品《朱昱侮辱尸体案》文字记录|url = http://arts.tom.com/Archive/1003/2003/7/8-46320.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040604083027/http://arts.tom.com/Archive/1003/2003/7/8-46320.html|date = 8 July 2003 |archivedate=4 June 2004 |language=Chinese}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = 朱昱_互动百科|url = http://www.baike.com/wiki/%25E6%259C%25B1%25E6%2598%25B1&prd=citiaorebang|website = ''Baike.com''|accessdate = 2015-11-21 |language=Chinese}}</ref> *In March 2001 in Germany, [[Armin Meiwes]] posted an Internet ad seeking a young man willing to be slaughtered and eaten. The ad was answered by [[Bernd Jürgen Brandes]]. Meiwes stabbed Brandes in the neck with a kitchen knife, kissing him first, then chopped him up into several pieces. He placed several pieces of Brandes in the freezer. Over the next few weeks, Meiwes defrosted and cooked parts of Brandes in olive oil and garlic and eventually consumed 20 kg of human flesh. Meiwes was convicted of [[manslaughter]] in 2004.<ref>{{cite news |last=Harding |first=Luke |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2004/jan/31/germany.lukeharding |title=Cannibal who fried victim in garlic is cleared of murder |work=The Guardian |date=31 January 2004 |accessdate=1 August 2012}}</ref> A retrial in 2006 found Meiwes guilty of murder, and sentenced him to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/4752797.stm |title=German cannibal guilty of murder |work=''BBC News''|date=9 May 2006 |accessdate=1 August 2012}}</ref> The songs, "Mein Teil" by [[Rammstein]] and "Eaten" by [[Bloodbath]], are based on this case. *In April 2001 in Kansas City, Kansas, United States, [[Marc Sappington]] went on a murder spree and was subsequently convicted of murdering four acquaintances. He gained notoriety for eating part of the leg of one of his victims, Alton "Fred" Brown. *In July 2002, four Ukrainians were arrested in [[Kiev]] for killing and eating a teenage girl. They were suspected of killing at least 6 people. Evidence showed that the murders may have been influenced by [[satanism]].<ref name=MN/> *In a 2003 drug-related case, the rap artist [[Big Lurch]] was convicted of the murder and partial consumption of an acquaintance while both were under the influence of [[Phencyclidine|PCP]].<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20050315215416/http://www.iol.co.za/index.php?click_id=79&art_id=qw1050304681718C461&set_id=1 'Cannibal rapper killed for gangsta image']. iol.co.za. April 14, 2003. Archived from [http://www.iol.co.za/index.php?click_id=79&art_id=qw1050304681718C461&set_id=1 the original] on 2005-03-15.</ref> *In 2003 and 2004, [[South Korea]]n [[Yoo Young-chul]], murdered a total of 21 people, eating the livers of several of his victims.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} *In February 2004, a 39-year-old Briton named [[Peter Bryan]] from East London, England, United Kingdom was caught after he killed his friend Brian Cherry and ate parts of his brain, fried in butter. He had been arrested for murder previously, but was released shortly before this act was committed. While on trial for the murder of Cherry, Bryan was sentenced to life imprisonment, despite his claim of [[diminished responsibility]].<ref>{{Cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/8234249.stm |work=''BBC News''| title=NHS 'failed' over cannibal killer | date=September 3, 2009 | accessdate=April 28, 2010 | first=Nick | last=Triggle}}</ref><ref>[http://news.sky.com/story/331370/fried-brains-cannibal-killer-guilty "Fried brains cannibal killer guilty"]. Sky News. 15 March 2005. Retrieved 2012-06-28.</ref> In January 2006, his sentence was revised to a minimum of 15 years.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/london/4666314.stm |title=Cannibal overturns jail tariff |work=''BBC News''|date=31 January 2006 |accessdate=16 August 2012}}</ref> *A count of 25 [[albino]] Tanzanians have been murdered since March 2007 reportedly through [[witch doctor]] butchery arising from prevailing superstition.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7518049.stm "Living in fear: Tanzania's albinos"]. BBC News. 21 July 2008.</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/nov/16/tanzania-humanrights "Albino Africans live in fear after witch-doctor butchery"]. ''The Observer''. November 16, 2008.</ref> In 2008, [[Tanzania]]'s President [[Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete|Kikwete]] publicly condemned witch doctors for killing people with albinism for their body parts, which are thought to bring good luck. *In 2006 and 2007, Indian serial killer [[2006 Noida serial murders|Surinder Koli]] killed and cannibalized 19 people, the majority of which were children.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-02-14/delhi/28055514_1_surender-koli-rimpa-halder-koli-in-nithari-case|title=Death for Pandher, Koli in Nithari case | work=The Times of India | first1=Abhinav |last1=Garg |date=2009-02-14}}</ref> His employer, Moninder Singh Pandher, was initially also convicted of the murders, but the conviction was later overturned.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/pandher-acquitted-in-a-nithari-case-kolis-sentence-upheld/article18442.ece|title=Pandher acquitted in a Nithari case; Koli’s sentence upheld}}</ref> *On January 5, 2007, French authorities reported that a prison inmate committed cannibalism on a cellmate, in the city of [[Rouen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/6234097.stm|title=France probes 'cannibalism' case |date=5 January 2007|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> *On January 13, 2007, [[Marco Evaristti]] hosted a dinner party where the main course was [[agnolotti]] pasta that was topped with a meatball made from his own fat, removed earlier in the year in a [[liposuction]] operation.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.news.com.au/weird-true-freaky/meal-fried-in-artists-own-body-fat/story-e6frflri-1111112825543 |title=Meal fried in artist's own body fat |date=2007-01-13 |publisher=[[news.com.au]] |accessdate=2008-10-27}}</ref> *On September 14, 2007, a man named [[Özgür Dengiz]] was captured in [[Ankara]], the [[Turkey|Turkish]] capital, after killing and eating a man. After cutting slices of flesh from his victim's body, Dengiz distributed the rest to stray dogs on the street, according to his own testimony. He ate some of the man's flesh raw on his way home. Dengiz, who lived with his parents, arrived at the family house and placed the remaining parts of the body in the refrigerator without saying a word to his parents.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=122330 |title=Newspaper ''Today's Zaman'' September 17, 2007 |work=Today's Zaman |date=September 17, 2007 |accessdate=August 30, 2009}}</ref><ref>[http://www.milliyet.com.tr/2007/09/16/guncel/agun.html "Yerli Hannibal'ın anatomisi"]. ''Milliyet''. September 16, 2007. {{tr icon}}</ref> *On October 8, 2008, Mexican police arrested [[José Luis Calva Zepeda]] for murder. Numerous pieces of cooked human flesh were discovered in his house. *In January 2008, notorious Liberian ex-rebel and reformed warlord [[Joshua Blahyi]], 37, confessed to participating in [[human sacrifice]]s which "included the killing of an innocent child and plucking out the heart, which was divided into pieces for us to eat." The cannibalism of many children occurred during the conflict in which Blahyi fought against Liberian president [[Charles Taylor (Liberia)|Charles Taylor]]'s militia.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Paye |first=Jonathan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7200101.stm |title= I ate children's hearts, ex-rebel says |work=''BBC News''|date=January 22, 2008 |accessdate=August 30, 2009}}</ref> On March 13, 2008, during the same war crimes trial, [[Joseph Marzah]], Taylor's chief of operations and head of Taylor's alleged "death squad", accused Taylor of ordering his soldiers to commit acts of cannibalism against enemies, including peacekeepers and United Nations personnel.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/africa/03/13/warcrimes.taylor.ap/index.html |title=Top aide testifies Taylor ordered soldiers to eat victims |publisher=CNN |date=March 13, 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080317165920/http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/africa/03/13/warcrimes.taylor.ap/index.html |archivedate=March 17, 2008}}</ref> *The [[murder of Tim McLean]] occurred on the evening of July 30, 2008. McLean, a 22-year-old Canadian man, was stabbed, beheaded and cannibalized while riding a Greyhound Canada bus near [[Portage la Prairie, Manitoba]]. According to witnesses, McLean was sleeping with his headphones on when the man sitting next to him, Vincent Li, suddenly produced a large knife and began stabbing McLean in the neck and chest. The attacker then decapitated McLean, severed other body parts, and consumed some of McLean's flesh. *In a documentary by Colombian journalist Hollman Morris, a demobilized [[Paramilitarism in Colombia|paramilitary]] confessed that during the mass killings that took place in Colombia's rural areas, many of the paras performed cannibalism. He also confessed that they were told to drink the blood of their victims in the belief that it would make them want to kill more.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uYcMKq6jBCs "Confesiones de un Ex-paramilitar" (parte I) //CONTRAVÍA//], YouTube.</ref> *In November 2008, a group of 33 undocumented immigrants from the [[Dominican Republic]], who were en route to [[Puerto Rico]], resorted to cannibalism after they were lost at sea for over 15 days before being rescued by a [[United States Coast Guard|U.S. Coast Guard]] patrol boat.<ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/27531105/ "Dominican migrant: We ate flesh to survive – A small group turned to cannibalism after being stranded in mid-ocean"]. MSNBC. November 4, 2008.</ref> *In February 2009, it was reported that five members of the [[Kulina (tribe of Brazil)|Kulina]] tribe in Brazil were wanted by Brazilian authorities on the charge of murdering, butchering, and eating a farmer in a ritual act of cannibalism.<ref name="Kunira">[http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/americas/02/09/brazil.ritual.cannibalism/index.html?iref=mpstoryview "Amazon Indians accused of cannibalizing farmer"]. CNN. February 9, 2009.</ref> *In April 2009, two men from the city of Perm, Russia, killed and ate their brother.<ref>{{cite web|title=Russian cannibals ‘eat their brother’|url=http://metro.co.uk/2009/04/15/video-bizarre-weird-world-sheep-squirrels-animals-penguins-sex-arrest-humour-humor-funny-stories-wacky-cat-washing-machine-ferret-chav-uk-britain-england-scotland-london-glasgow-31032/|work=Metro UK|accessdate=15 April 2009|date=1 November 2014}}</ref> *In May 2009, Angelo Mendoza was charged with mayhem, torture, child cruelty, and inflicting an injury to a child for eating his then 4-year-old son’s left eye out and damaging the boy’s right eye, while high on PCP. Angelo Mendoza Jr. told authorities “my daddy ate my eyes,” when they came to the scene. *On July 27, 2009, an American woman, Otty Sanchez, was found in a hysterical state by police, having killed her own child and cannibalized parts of the infant's corpse.<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/07/27/otty-sanchez-woman-accuse_n_245627.html "Otty Sanchez, Woman Accused Of Killing Newborn, Ate Brain: Police"]. ''HuffPost''. 27 July 2009. Retrieved 2012-07-04.</ref> *On November 14, 2009, three homeless men in [[Perm, Russia]] were arrested for killing and eating the parts of a 25-year-old male victim. The remaining body parts were then sold to a local pie and kebab house.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/3-suspected-of-cannibalism/389513.html|title=3 Suspected of Cannibalism|work=The Moscow Times|date=November 16, 2009}}</ref> *Between 2009 and 2011, a Berlinskoe, Russia resident and serial killer [[Alexander Bychkov]] engaged in numerous acts of cannibalism, targeting people he had previously lured into his house.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mk.ru/incident/2012/03/29/687104-zverinyiy-oskal-kannibalizma.html|title=Звериный оскал каннибализма|work=The Moscow Times|accessdate=20 November 2014|date=29 March 2012}}</ref>
=== 2010s–present ===
*In April and May 2010, PhD student Stephen Griffiths from [[Bradford]], England, United Kingdom, killed and ate three prostitutes, becoming known as the [[Bradford murders|Crossbow Cannibal]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/crime/8216545/Crossbow-cannibal-jailed-for-wicked-and-monstrous-prostitute-murders.html|title=Crossbow cannibal jailed for wicked and monstrous' prostitute murders|work=The Telegraph|date=21 December 2010|accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> *In April 2011, in the town of [[Darya Khan]], Punjab, Pakistan, brothers Arif Ali and Farman Ali were arrested for eating a human corpse stolen from a grave. They were cooking body parts for a meal when arrested; the police also recovered remains of human body parts from their house.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-south-asia-12989074|title=Pakistani duo are accused of cannibalism |work=''BBC News''|accessdate=April 7, 2011|date=April 6, 2011}}</ref> The brothers were released from jail in 2013; however, in April 2014, they were once again discovered to be making curry out of a human corpse (this time, the body of a two- to three-year-old child), presumed to have been stolen from a graveyard.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-27019630 |title=Pakistan suspected cannibal in Punjab re-arrested |work=''BBC News''|date=April 14, 2014}}</ref> *On July 9, 2011, a model in the Leningrad region of Russia drowned her colleague and consumed parts of her corpse. She was later detained, found guilty of murder, and sent to a psychiatric hospital for treatment, where she was diagnosed with [[schizophrenia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newizv.ru/lenta/2013-03-15/179367-osuzhdena-devushka-kotoraja-utopila-svoju-podrugu-i-pytalas-ee-sest.html|title=Осуждена модель, которая утопила свою подругу и пыталась ее съесть|date=4 October 2012|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> *In August 2011, police found the body parts of various people in serial killer [[Matej Curko]]'s refrigerator, including the body parts of two Slovakian women who disappeared in 2010.<ref>Sideri, Massimo (August 2, 2011). [http://www.corriere.it/english/11_agosto_02/cannibal-victims_fa52f944-bcf3-11e0-b530-d2ad6f731cf9.shtml "Slovak Cannibal's Possible Italian Victims – Thirty Missing Women Profiled"], ''Corriere della Sera''.</ref> *In 2011, officials in [[South Korea]] received a tip that ethnic [[Koreans in China|Koreans living in China]] were smuggling [[Capsule (pharmacy)|drug capsules]] into the country that contained powder made from dead babies, passing them off as stamina boosters. The ethnic Korean citizens of China tried to smuggle them into South Korea and consume the capsules or distribute them to other ethnic Korean citizens of China living in South Korea. Reportedly, the capsules were made in northeastern China from dead fetuses whose bodies were chopped into small pieces and dried on stoves before being turned into powder.<ref>{{cite news |date=<!-- 12:55PM BST --> 7 May 2012 |title= Pills filled with powdered human baby flesh found by customs officials |url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/southkorea/9250438/Pills-filled-with-powdered-human-baby-flesh-found-by-customs-officials.html |newspaper=The Telegraph }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date= 7 May 2012 <!-- 18:45 GMT --> |title=S Korea cracks down on 'human flesh capsules' |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia-pacific/2012/05/201257142432164324.html |publisher=Al Jazeera }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Leigh |first=Rob |date= <!-- 18:05 --> 7 May 2012 |title= Sickening foetus trade: South Korea orders crackdown on human flesh capsules 'made from dead babies' smuggled in from China |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/human-flesh-capsules-dead-babies-822852 |newspaper=Mirror Online }}</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/may/07/south-korea-drugs-dead-babies "South Korea seizes drugs made from dead babies"]. ''The Guardian''. 7 May 2012.</ref> *Dennis Storm and Valerio Zeno, the two presenters of the Dutch TV show, ''Proefkonijnen'', ate each other's flesh on air in December 2011. They were filmed having a piece of their muscle tissue surgically removed, which was then fried and eaten in front of a studio audience.<ref>Milimaci, Grace (December 20, 2011). [http://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/a/-/offbeat/12412773/tv-presenters-eat-each-others-flesh "TV presenters eat each other's flesh"]. ''The West Australian''. Retrieved May 28, 2012.</ref> *In December 2011, a Florida, United States man killed and ate a homeless man in the city of Bridgeport, [[Connecticut]], United States. The perpetrator of the crime was later found insane and committed to a maximum-security psychiatric hospital.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2013/09/10/florida-man-receives-60-years-in-connecticut-cannibalism-case/|title=Florida man receives 60 years in Connecticut cannibalism case|publisher=Fox News Channel|date=10 September 2013|accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> *On March 21, 2012, a [[Vladivostok]] man killed his friend, later selling his meat in a local market. Another man was convicted of willingly consuming the flesh of the victim.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newizv.ru/lenta/2012-03-26/161210-dva-kannibala-vladivostoka-zakusili-znakomym-a-ostatki-mjasa-prodali-na-rynke.html|title=Два каннибала Владивостока закусили знакомым, а остатки мяса продали на рынке|date=26 March 2012|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> *On April 13, 2012, a Japanese man named [[Mao Sugiyama]] cut off, cooked, and served his genitals to five people. Each of the diners paid 250 $ per portion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/05/24/asexual-mao-sugiyama-cooks-serves-own-genitals_n_1543307.html|title=Mao Sugiyama Cooks, Serves Own Genitals At Banquet In Tokyo|work=HuffPost |date=24 May 2012|accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> *In April 2012, a man and two women were arrested in the town of [[Garanhuns]], Pernambuco, Brazil for murdering at least two women and eating their flesh. One of the female suspects is said to have used some of the flesh of her victims for making pasties, which she allegedly sold in the town.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-17710617 | title=Brazil murder suspects 'confess to cannibalism' |work=''BBC News''|accessdate=April 14, 2012|date=April 13, 2012}}</ref> *In April 2012, Jieming Liu, 79, was accused of killing his wife and eating some of her flesh in [[Shrewsbury, Massachusetts, United States]]. The couple had immigrated from China in November 2011.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://boston.cbslocal.com/2012/05/05/shrewsbury-man-accused-of-killing-wife-cannibalism-dies-in-hospital/ | title=Shrewsbury Man Accused Of Killing Wife & Cannibalism Dies In Hospital | publisher=boston.cbslocal.com | agency=[[Associated Press]] | date=May 5, 2012 | accessdate=5 April 2014}}</ref> *In May 2012, [[Murder of Kujoe Bonsafo Agyei-Kodie|Kujoe Bonsafo Agyei-Kodie]], an exchange student from Ghana, was murdered by Alexander Kinyua in Maryland, United States. Kinyua had eaten Agyei-Kodies' organs in an act of cannibalism. *On May 26, 2012, police in [[Miami]], [[Florida, United States]], shot and killed [[Rudy Eugene]], 31, after he was found on the [[MacArthur Causeway]] naked and eating the face of Ronald Poppo, 65, who was homeless at the time. Police believed that Eugene was under the influence of a synthetic drug, but the autopsy of Eugene showed only marijuana in his system.<ref>[http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/06/27/2871098/mes-report-eugene-had-no-drugs.html "No bath salts detected: Causeway attacker Rudy Eugene had only pot in his system, medical examiner reports"]. ''The Miami Herald''. 27 June 2012.</ref> A [[Closed-circuit television|security camera]] at the headquarters of the ''[[Miami Herald]]'' caught the attack live on film, which quickly began making rounds on the internet.<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/05/28/cannibal-attack-naked-man-shot-dead-in-miami-as-he-chewed-victims-face-video_n_1549896.html "'Cannibal' Attack: Naked Man Shot Dead In Miami 'As He Chewed Victim's Face'"]. ''HuffPost''. 28 May 2012.</ref> Poppo has had facial surgery since the attack and is having treatment for his face.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/news/ronald-poppo-face-chewing-victim-still-recovering-one-year-later-hospital/ "Ronald Poppo, face-chewing victim, still recovering one year later: Hospital"]. CBS News. May 21, 2013.</ref> *In July 2012, 29 members of a cannibal cult were arrested in northeast [[Papua New Guinea]] after eating at least seven people (four men and three women) believed to be sorcerers.<ref>[http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10817610 "Cannibal cult members arrested in PNG"]. ''The New Zealand Herald''. 5 July 2012. Retrieved 2012-07-12</ref><ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/australiaandthepacific/papuanewguinea/9378038/Cannibal-killers-delay-Papua-New-Guinea-poll.html "Cannibal killers delay Papua New Guinea poll"]. ''The Telegraph''. 5 July 2012. Retrieved 2012-07-12</ref> *In October 2012, Japanese authorities convicted three men for killing and eating a common friend in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newizv.ru/lenta/2012-10-04/170916-troe-muzhchin-iz-japonii-prigotovili-svoego-znakomogo-na-grile.html|title=Трое мужчин из Японии приготовили своего знакомого на гриле|date=4 October 2012|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> *On December 26, 2012, Mridul Kumar Bhattacharya and his wife Rita Bhattacharya who owned tea gardens in Assam, India were murdered by an angry mob of workers. Cannibalism was later reported in the incident.<ref>{{cite news |last=Mazumdar |first=Prasanta |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report_assam-tea-workers-ate-flesh-after-killing-owner_1784064 |title=Assam tea workers ate flesh after killing owner |work=Daily News and Analysis |date=January 1, 2013 |accessdate=January 1, 2013}}</ref> *On January 10, 2013, the Chinese cannibal [[Zhang Yongming]], aged 57, was executed for his crimes. He sold victims’ flesh as ‘ostrich meat’ and kept eyeballs in wine.<ref>[https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/china-cannibal-monster-zhang-yongming-1528161 Cannibal killer who sold victims’ flesh as ‘ostrich meat’ and kept eyeballs in wine bottles executed in China], 10 Jan 2013, Natalie Evans, ''Daily Mirror'', retrieved at 2013-02-08</ref><ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2013/01/11/zhang-yongming-serial-killer-cannibal-monster-executed-china-_n_2454280.html Zhang Yongming, Serial Killer Dubbed 'Cannibal Monster' Is Executed In China], 11 Jan 2013, Sara C Nelson, ''HuffPost'', retrieved at 2013-02-08</ref> *In April 2013, British punk rock musician David Playpenz ate his finger after it was severed in a motorcycle accident<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.odditycentral.com/wtf/man-cooks-and-eats-his-own-finger-after-losing-it-in-an-accident.html|title=Man Cooks and Eats His Own Finger After Losing It in an Accident|work=The Sun|date=23 April 2013|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref> *On March 17, 2013, a 47-year-old man mutilated, sexually assaulted and ate pieces of a 77-year-old woman, in [[North Bay, Ontario, Canada]]. He reportedly suffered from severe depression and the court found his attack was perpetrated during a psychotic incident, rendering him not criminally responsible.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nugget.ca/2013/06/18/senior-mutilated-in-cannibalism-ritual|title=Senior mutilated in cannibalism ritual|work=Nugget|date=18 June 2013|accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> *In May 2013, during the [[Syrian civil war]], a rebel named Abu Sakkar was filmed cutting open the body of a fallen enemy soldier and biting into one of his organs – it is unclear what he bit into.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-23190533|title=Face-to-face with Abu Sakkar, Syria's 'heart-eating cannibal'|date=July 5, 2013|work=''BBC News''| first=Paul | last=Wood}}</ref> *In July 2013, Lino Renzi, aged 45, was found out while cooking some remains of his mother, Maria Pia Guariglia, aged 73, in his apartment by the police, called by a neighbour after smelling a disgusting odor coming from Renzi's apartment, probably caused by some intestine chunks burning on the grill. The cops discovered moreover several pieces of human body in a freezer, oven and pots, while most of the corpse, lying in the bathroom, featured severe mutilation to arms and legs, besides several intestine pieces removed. Later on, Renzi confessed his mother had not died of natural causes, but she'd been brutally beaten to death by himself after a quarrel, then dismembered into pieces with a saw and a butcher knife.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/crime/italian-man-suspected-eat-dead-mother-article-1.1407404 |title=Italian man suspected of trying to eat mother detained after body parts found in pot, oven, freezer: cops |work=Daily News|location=New York |date=2013-07-24 |accessdate=2014-03-28}}</ref> *On January 13, 2014, [[BBC]] reported that a Christian man nicknamed "Mad Dog" ate his Muslim rival's foot, during the [[Central African Republic conflict (2012–present)|CAR conflict]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rus.delfi.ee/daily/abroad/nasilie-v-car-ochevidcy-soobschayut-o-kannibalizme?id=67598590|title=Насилие в ЦАР: очевидцы сообщают о каннибализме|date=13 January 2014|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> *On September 15, 2014, a man from [[Jeffersonville, Indiana]], United States, killed and ate parts of his girlfriend.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140919020103/https://www.wishtv.com/2014/09/15/police-indiana-man-mutilated-girlfriends-body/|title=Police: Indiana man admits to cannibalism|publisher=Wish TV|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> *On October 31, 2014, a crowd stoned to death, burned, and then ate a suspected [[Allied Democratic Forces]] insurgent in the town of [[Beni, North Kivu]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. The incident came after a number of ADF [[Allied Democratic Forces insurgency|raids]], that brought the October's civilian death toll to over 100 people.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://news.yahoo.com/congo-crowd-kills-man-eats-him-militant-massacres-160235263.html|title=Congo crowd kills man, eats him after militant massacres: witnesses|date=31 October 2014|accessdate=31 October 2014}}</ref> *On November 6, 2014, Matthew Williams, 34, was allegedly found eating his 22-year-old victim's face in a room of the Sirhowy Arms Hotel in the village of Argoed, near Blackwood, South Wales, United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/crime/11216803/Family-of-cannibal-Matthew-Williams-pay-tribute-to-victim-Cerys-Yemm.html |title=Family of 'cannibal' Matthew Williams pay tribute to victim Cerys Yemm |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date= November 7, 2014 |accessdate=November 8, 2014}}</ref> *On 6 January, 2015, a [[Reuters]] report revealed that the [[La Familia Michoacana]] and the |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/jan/9/mexican-cartel-recruits-eat-human-hearts/|title=Mexican cartel recruits eat human hearts in cannibalistic initiation ceremonies|work=The Washington attack|access-date=2016-09-12}}</ref> * In 2017, a ring of cannibals was arrested by the police and tried in South Africa.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-41072524|title=Shock lung afterwards over a stove. <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/5871366/russian-cannibal-butchers-mum/|title=Russian cannibal butchered mum-of-two, cooked her heart and ate it|date=2018-03-22|work=The Sun|access-date=2018-11-11|language=en-GB}}</ref> *On 30 October, 2018, a father and son were detained in [[Saltivka]], [[Kharkiv]], [[Ukraine]] after being accused of Ask me anything|website=reddit|language=en|access-date=2018-11-24}}</ref> legally ate and shared his amputated foot with 10 of his friends. After an accident 2 years earlier his foot would not heal and the doctors suggested that he would be better if he amputated it. So then he asked his friends:"Remember how we always talked about how, if we ever had the chance to ethically eat human meat, would you do it?", and that lead that the friends shared his foot. <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/gykmn7/legal-ethical-cannibalism-human-meat-tacos-reddit-wtf|title=This Guy Served His Friends Tacos Made from His Own Amputated Leg|date=2018-06-12|work=Vice|access-date=2018-11-24|language=en-us}}</ref>
